data.title: vscode can't maintain text highlight when line comment selected text over multiple lines with keyboard shortcut
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. select multiple lines of code
2. use `ctrl+/` to perform single line comment on the selected text, and see that text highlight is incorrect at start of the resultant string.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4483325/29192241-50d76494-7de6-11e7-87a9-41299233513c.png)

data.title: [bug] rapidly using keyboard short cut combines them resulting in strange error message
data.body:
I came from other editor, and keyboard shortcut is `ctrl+k` for line comment, and `ctrl+shift+k` for undo line comment.

so i tried this:

i hit `ctrl+k` to try and comment, and error message displayed about being a wrong key commands.
i then immediately remembered and hit `ctrl+/` for the line comment, now it says:
- `ctrl+k,ctrl+/` is an invalid key command.

data.title: Emmet suggestions is not at the top of the suggestion dialog
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0 8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.5, Windows 10

Fresh installation, without plugins.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create .css or .scss file
2. Start typing CSS rule ("w" for width, for example)
3. At the top, you will get "white-space" suggestion.

This also works for the following rules:
h (height) -> height (but Emmet's abbreviation at the third place)
t (top) -> tab-size
l (left) -> left (but Emmet's abbreviation at the ninth place)
tac (text-align: center) -> touch-action
...and much more. 

ttu not working, while tdn works just fine (Emmet's abbreviation at the first place)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

To avoid this issue in the previous version, I've used these keybinding settings

```
{
        "key": "tab",
        "command": "tab",
        "when": "editorTextFocus && !editorTabMovesFocus"
},
{
        "key": "tab",
        "command": "editor.emmet.action.expandAbbreviation",
        "when": "editorTextFocus && !editorHasSelection && !editorHasMultipleSelections && !editorTabMovesFocus"
}
```
but now I'm getting an error:

"Warn: Running the contributed command:'emmet.expandAbbreviation' failed."

data.title: Visibility of custom view icons should be independent of File Icon Theme option
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:16:06.988Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063

Since 1.15.0 the item icons of custom views disappear if File Icon Theme is set to None. This is a bug in my opinion as custom views don't necessarily have anything to do with files and more critically the icons may carry semantic information that is now lost, making some extensions (including mine, see below) unusable. The extension that provides the view should have the ability to decide whether the view should follow the File Icon Theme option or not. I suggest to revert the relevant change and discuss the intended behaviour before committing to anything.

[![](https://github.com/letmaik/vscode-git-tree-compare/raw/master/screenshots/main.png)](https://github.com/letmaik/vscode-git-tree-compare)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/530988/29190260-557b0a66-7e11-11e7-9a56-68c599956388.png)

data.title: Content security warning in Markdown preview won't go away
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (2c3e2c291c515619f64e7c9cddf14c565b7f3d92, 2017-08-08T21:31:44.273Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
spellright|ban|1.0.42
markdown-preview-github-styles|bie|0.0.1
wordcount|ms-|0.1.0
material-icon-theme|PKi|2.1.0
htmlescape-vscode-extension|ray|0.0.4



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Turn on Markdown preview with content that triggers the warning
2. Select Allow insecure content
3. The "Some content has been disabled in this document" warning does not go away.

After I've made a decision, why is the warning label staying in the view? It's annoying and actually blocks text. Not a lot, but still.

If I select the Disable option it goes away, but any option should make it go away after I've made a selection.

data.title: Feature Request: Open next file with problems

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: The problems panel is incredibly helpful, especially when used with linters on large projects during refactors. However, it would be really helpful if there was a command that would allow you to open the next unopened file that has problems. This would allow users to quickly track down and remove errors during large code shifts.

data.title: When restarting VSCode, only one window restored to fullscreen

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:06:21.685Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Ensure `window.restoreFullscreen` is set to `true`
2. Open multiple VSCode windows and fullscreen them
3. Restart VSCode
4. Observe only one of the windows is fullscreen; the rest are now windowed.

data.title: Update ctrl+left and ctrl+right word boundary commands to be consistent with other platforms
data.body:
In vscode when I navigate with ctrl+left and ctrl+right it stops on either side of word boundary characters rather than going to the beginning/end of each word. This behavior is inconsistent from other platforms. I've checked both sublime text, and chrome. (Even as I type in this submit an issue text box.)

If you have text that looks like:

`this.is.a.test` and navigate with ctrl+left or ctrl+right, in most platforms you get from the beginning to the end with 4 key presses. With vscode it takes 7.

A few gifs to illustrate, pressing ctrl+left to get to the beginning and then ctrl+right to get to the end.:

Sublime Text:
![sublime-word](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1206952/29186618-43f20692-7dca-11e7-923d-3708b3da5803.gif)

Chrome:
![chrome-word](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1206952/29186623-49bca44c-7dca-11e7-8e51-e15c74a8e21b.gif)

vscode:
![vscode-word](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1206952/29186631-4f51e520-7dca-11e7-82a3-7a077c014868.gif)

data.title: Refactor FindWidget: shareable find component with history/commands

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
We added find widget for terminal and webview in last two iterations. Right now the way we reuse this component is still at view level, but features like history navigation, command registration, search state maintaining should be put into the component as well, instead of duplicating code in different areas.

Task list:
* [ ] History navigation
* [ ] Sharable component with commands
* [ ] Move search states into Find Widget

@cleidigh already started https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/32113 and it's a pretty good start.

data.title: How to debug javascript code on VS Code Terminal?
data.body:
Hi

I just made a code and I am trying to debug it using Visual Studio Code (using it's Terminal).

I have no problem to debug my javascript code but the issue is that I am passing parameters via console.

Here is a sample of it: ` C:\projs\myProject> node app.js arg1 arg2 arg3`

data.title: Run the default build task from launch configuration

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently, I can specify a `preLaunchTask` field in a launch configuration to run a task before launching. That's great! To use preLaunchTask, I need to give my task an identifier first. Typically, I want to run the default build task before I launch, though. VSCode already knows which task is the default build task, so I feel like there should be a way to tell VSCode to run this task without giving it an identifier.

If one of my tasks.json entries contains the following snippet, VSCode knows that this is the default build task:

```
"group": {
	"kind": "build",
	"isDefault": true
}
```


What if there were a field in launch.json named something like `preLaunchBuild` that could be set to `true` to tell it to run the default build task before launching? `preLaunchTask` would still be useful for running other tasks, but if I just want to run the default build task, I don't need to take the extra step of giving the default build task its own identifier.

data.title: Color Picker: Finalize Color Picker API
data.body:
There are two APIs we need to finalize: **Monaco** and **VSCode**.

Both APIs are identical except in terms of color formatters: VSCode supports a [declarative format for color formats](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/vscode.proposed.d.ts#L178), while Monaco supports [more generic function-style formatters](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/common/modes.ts#L687).

**Discussion Points**

- [ ] **Color value ranges** - We have a very peculiar [`Color` class](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/common/color.ts) internally, which has predefined value ranges for color components. RGB is stored in ranges of `[0-255]`, for example. I am more in favor of using floating point `[0-1]` ranges for all color coordinates in the API. This is what is currently implemented. We just need consensus on the approach.
- [ ] **`Color.fromHex`** - I suggest we keep this in proposed state until #32295 is fixed, at which point it can be completely removed.
- [ ] **Color Insertion** - The current API works great with colors which are already in the document. Both the API and the color picker widget don't work really well when the user wants to _insert_ a new color. This needs thought. I think we can surface this as a feature request so we can get the API out the door asap.

data.title: SCM: Support multiple repositories
Equality error in Diff Code
data.body:
Hi we were seeing a demo of SomarCube and it pointed out that this line looks like an error...

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/c05c85b45f19ab1c3238595ec83ca854dbda8398/src/vs/base/common/diff/diff.ts#L863

Specifically `modifiedStart < modifiedStart` which will always be false.

Sean

data.title: Emmet adds color proposal that duplicates css proposal
Some user snippets don't want to appear in the snippets list
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: win7x64

Steps to Reproduce:

Here is my snippet for **getElementsByClassName** in **javascript.json** file:

```
"getElementsByClassName": {
  "prefix": "cla",
  "body": [
    "getElementsByClassName(\"$1\");$0"
  ],
  "description": "getElementsByClassName"
}
```
So, as you can see in GIF, VS Code doesn't want to include my snippet right after typing, for example, **document.body.**, and it appears only after removing 1 or more letters from "cla" and starting again.

Should be fixed.



GIF:

![snippets list _ 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24613274/29177592-bf112f6a-7df7-11e7-8129-1f13ff6e0e80.gif)
